snippet.title: 3 kids, 2 adults killed in school bus crash
snippet.description: A school bus carrying three children and a semi-truck crashed on U.S. Route 24 in Illinois, killing all passengers and both drivers, police said.

localized.title: 3 kids, 2 adults killed in school bus crash
localized.description: A school bus carrying three children and a semi-truck crashed on U.S. Route 24 in Illinois, killing all passengers and both drivers, police said.

video_transcript: we turn out of that horrific crash there is news coming in tonight of an awful crash a collision between a school bus and a tractor trailer both vehicles erupting into flames both drivers were killed along with three children on that bus ABC's Alex pet tonight with what authorities have just now revealed tonight a horrific crash scene along this Illinois highway after a semi collided with a school bus killing five people including all three preschool age children on board Route 24 in front of scrips Park School semi accident at least one vehicle on fire it happened about 60 Mi west of Springfield police say just after 11:30 this morning the bus crossed the line into oncoming traffic and then into the path of that truck hauling sand the bus was traveling west on Route 24 and for an unknown reason crossed over into the eastbound Lanes in front of the semi TR both vehicles became engulfed in flames both drivers were also killed the school bus scene here barely recognizable when you have lost lives like this uh it's it's devastating it's quite a tragedy David tonight authorities were asked if drugs or alcohol played a role in this crash frankly they can't answer that yet this investigation is just getting started David we're thinking about those families tonight Alex thank you hi everyone George Stephanopoulos here thanks for checking out the ABC News YouTube channel if you'd like to get more videos show highlights and watch live event coverage click on the right over here to subscribe to our Channel and don't forget to download the ABC News app for breaking news alerts thanks for watching

video_comments.comment_text:
Why even go to the drugs/alcohol question right away? Why is that normal? 
Tire failure, heart attack, deer in the road, kids fighting on the bus....

replies.comment_text:
Because none of those things are among the leading cause of vehicle crashes? The vast majority of crashes are caused by human error; distracted driving, speeding and impaired driving. In that order.

Mechanical problems, health issues and deer make up a very small percentage of crashes. Kids fighting on the bus could count as "distracted driving" but I doubt it, school bus drivers deal with that on a daily basis and usually don't crash.

There's a reason it's increasingly common for authorities not to call them "accidents" any more because they're almost always caused by someone doing something stupid.

video_comments.comment_text: These are not real truck drivers anymore.

replies.comment_text: the school bus driver was at fault. Not the trucker
@@linx7130 someone can become a bus driver really easily
